subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Managing Conflict: Turning Tension into Progress
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Managing Conflict: Turning Tension into Progress.

hook.text: Steve Jobs and Jony Ive fought constantly about design decisions. Those arguments produced the iPhone.

buildup.text: Healthy conflict is task-focused disagreement. Toxic conflict is personal attack. The difference is everything.

discovery.text: Lencioni's research shows teams that avoid conflict make worse decisions than teams that argue well.

twist.text: Most founders avoid conflict because it feels threatening. But artificial harmony kills startups quietly.

climax.text: Pixar's 'Braintrust' meetings demand honest criticism. No rank, no politicsâ€”just brutal feedback on the work.

punchline.text: The best teams don't avoid conflict. They get good at it.

quiz.question: What is the difference between healthy and toxic conflict?
options: Healthy conflict focuses on tasks and ideas; toxic conflict targets people personally
Healthy conflict happens quietly; toxic conflict is loud
All conflict is toxic and should be avoided in startups
